title: BBC World War One: Beyond the Trenches S01 720p HDTV x264 - GHOS
description:
World War One was a truly global war. This series looks at events beyond Europe's Western Front, exploring some of the lesser-known tales of the Great War from Africa, Asia and the Middle East.

***********************************************************************************
Episodes:

1. Race to Kamina
Akwasi Sarpong travels to Togo in West Africa to uncover the real story of the first Allied victory in World War One.

2. The Nurse of the Mediterranean
The tiny island of Malta saved the lives of thousands of wounded soldiers during World War I. Dr Kevin Fong explores how it earned the name, the Nurse of the Mediterranean.

3. The Famine of Mount Lebanon
This episode tells the forgotten story of starvation and disease that ravaged Mount Lebanon during WWI, killing a third of its population.
BBC Arabic's Carine Torbey examines how they suffered and survived.

4. Siege of Tsingtao
The only battle to be fought in the Far East during WWI had an explosive and lasting impact on Sino-Japanese relations.
Carol Yarwood from the BBC's Chinese Service recounts the Siege of Tsingtao.

5. The Indestructible Warship, Tanzania
100 years ago, it was the fearsome German warship that ruled the waters of Lake Tanganyika, today it runs as the world's oldest passenger ferry. 
Zuhura Yunus takes a journey aboard the MV Liemba.
